title: F My Life - Maxime Valette
description:
Today, my boss fired me via text message. I donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have a text messaging plan. I paid 25 cents to get fired.

Your girlfriend dumped you, your car broke down, your boss passed you up for the big promotion. LifeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not fair, but there is one sure-fire way to ease your painÃ¢â‚¬â€œlaughing at someone else who had an even worse day than you did. 

Enter the devastatingly funny world of F My Life, where calamity is comedy. Covering every disastrous pratfall in love, work, family-life, and more, F My Life proffers other peopleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ruinous, real-life happenings to brighten your gloomiest day: someone getting dumped through a greeting card, ignored at their birthday party, or insulted by their own grandmother. Spanning everything from ironic twists of fate to down-right shameful moments, F My LifeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s squirm-inducing stories are schadenfreude at its finest. So today, take solace in knowing that at least youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re not that guy. There now, donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t you feel better?

Today, my boyfriend broke up with me. I cried and told him that I loved him. He gave me a quarter and told me to call someone who cared. I threw the quarter in his face and ran. I waited for the bus, but when I got on, I realized I was 25 cents short of the fare. I walked home in the rain. 

Today, my mom walked in on me looking at a 1978 Playboy. She asked if I found it in the basement. I said yes. Then I realized she was the centerfold. 

Today, I got in line at the grocery store. The woman in front of me looked right at me, turned to her friend, and said Ã¢â‚¬Å“That reminds me, I forgot to get acne cream.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
